Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Mobile Bearing and Fixed Bearing Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: We randomised 507 primary TKAs in 416 eligible patients

Participants.evidence: 416 eligible patients at a single center

Intervention.evidence: allocated to receive either MB (n=252) or FB (n=255) devices

Objective.evidence: assessed whether mobile bearing (MB) total knee arthroplasty (TKA) improves function, survivorship, and reduces complications compared to fixed bearing (FB) TKA

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in WOMAC Index scores over 24 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: using a computer-generated randomisation method with concealed allocation

Blinding.evidence: Patients were blinded to treatment allocation

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomised 507 primary TKAs in 416 eligible patients at a single center from November 2001 to August 2007

Number_Analysed.evidence: Revision was required in 19/252 MB and 13/255 FB knees

Result_Outcome.evidence: Estimated 6-year survival was 90.1% (95% CI, 84.1–93.9) for MB and 94.2% (95% CI, 90.1–96.6) for FB

Harms.evidence: Device failures and complications were monitored until October 2009

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under NCT00946075
